snippet: Usain Bolt is still the Olympic champion at 100 meters, having won in the fastest collective 100-meter race ever with a time of 9.63 seconds.
abstract: Usain Bolt wins the gold and remains Olympic champion at 100 meters, having won in the fastest collective 100-meter race ever with a time of 9.63 seconds; becomes the first man to successfully defend his Olympic 100 title; Yohan Blake, also of Jamaica, wins the silver and Justin Gatlin of the United States takes the bronze.

byline.contributor: Ken Belson, Andrew Das and Campbell Robertson contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Usain Bolt is still the Olympic champion at 100 meters, having won in the fastest collective 100-meter race ever with a time of 9.63 seconds.

headline.seo: Usain Bolt of Jamaica Defends Gold in 100 Meters
headline.main: In Fastest Field Ever, the World’s Fastest Man Proves It Again
headline.print_headline: In Fastest Field Ever, the World’s Fastest Man Proves It Again
